title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard in the Java IDE is displaying a confusing message when invoked. The message states 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' even when the package name field is empty. This message is causing confusion among users as they are unsure about its meaning and why it is being displayed. There are also questions about whether this is an error that should be displayed in red with the error icon or just a warning message.
OB: When invoking the New Package Wizard without entering anything in the package name field, a message stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' appears at the top of the wizard.
EB: When invoking the New Package Wizard without entering anything in the package name field, no message should appear at the top of the wizard.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new Java Project.
2. Select the project.
3. Open the New Package Wizard.
4. Leave the package name field empty and proceed to the next step.
5. Observe any message displayed at the top of the wizard.
